titleStmt.title: Suzanna Peel: Memoir
titleStmt.principal:
Katherine Mary Faull, Principal Investigator Bucknell University
Lewisburg, Pennsylvania
faull@bucknell.edu

Christer Ahlberger, Principal Investigator, 2015-2018 University of Gothenburg
Gothenburg, Sweden
christer.ahlberger@history.gu.se

div.p: Susannah Peel at Claketon in Barstel Parish Octber ye 17th 1729

When She was very Young She was Left with out Farther & Mother, and by that meens was Left to the Care of her Relations Among whom She has Lived ever Since till She began to hear the Bren, in ye Year, 49, when She occording to her Earnest desier was taken in to the EOconemy at Claketn, were where She remaind till the EOconemy remov'd to Tyrsal-hall, were She became more Acquainte with our Saviour, She was a Chearfull and happy heart, her Disposishon was Childlike an honest which made her belvoed by all the Sisters, who had to do with her, in the Year 51, She got a great desier to be recived in to the Congregation, which was granted to her Janry ye 12 1751 She was very much rejoised that our Saviour had granted her the faviour to be one of his Chose peope, She Soon Longed very much to be made apertaker, of the holy Sacrament, which Grace She enjoyed for the first time August ye 13th in the Same Year, it was avery weaight and preciour Grace to her, that She was now apertake of the Corpess and blood of her Dearest Lord and Saviour She was then quit Chearfull, and one Could percive that her whole aim and intension was; to be a plesuer to his heart, Who had Shed his blood for her; when the Sisters removed out of the EOconemys, into the Choir-house, She had the faviour to be one of them, and thought her Self highly faviourd, that She had aplase among that Choir Which our Saviour him Self has brought to gether, to be an Honer to his Name, and a reward for all his Smart and pain
in March 53 She got bad leges and they brok out in Sores, as also her feet the Docter used meens which helpd her for A short time
but towards the End of ye Year it returnd again

and has Continued to return every Spring and fall She however remaind very patien under it and Complaind very Little, She often Longd to be at home with our Saviour, for She Said that her Disorder was of Such a natuer, that She was Likely to be very troblesom to the Sisters, which was some pain to her, but her Chearfulness of heart made it aplesuer to see her;

When the dear Desipl and mother was here in the Year 54 and keept the first Choir Sacrament She had the faviour to be one of that Number it was a great adishon to her joy, that her Bridegroom and Lover had ownd an such a manner, tho She according to her thoughts was one of the meenest and has meny times since Said that in all her Life She Could not forget, and when She Shou'd once get the faviour to see her frind and Lover She would kiss his bleed ing feet for it.

in March Last She began to Cough, and her Sores did not Appear much but it Strulk more in her, and Settled on her Longes, She made Use Of Medisens, but it was to no Affect, it was so in her mind that our Saviour would soon fetch her to him Self, this became daly more plain to her and She only wishd that her time might be Short, for She Longd much to be at home July the 17 ye 13th She took to the Sick-room out of which She Came nomoe her disorder was not all aside with much pain; but She has been Carrid an in a very easy manner, drind her whole Sickness She has remaind in a Close Conextion with the man of Smart, so that one Could feel it when ever one Spok with her; her heart burnt with tender Longing after her Eternal Bridegroom

She meny time Expressd in word how near She felt him, and how tender-Ly he imbraced Her Perticulerly the Last Sacrament, of which She got her Share in the Sick-room, the time before when She enjoyd it with hannah Clark, She was some what grived that She went before her, but how ever Satisfied her Self Saying, I Shall Stay one Lordsupper more, and then I Shall go to the Saviour; being Asked if She Shoud Like to Stay till the near enjoyment She Said yeas if he will have me Stay, I am resind, but not for that, I will not Stay, becose when I am with him I Shall alwas always keep the Lord-supper

She then begd our Saviour Soon to fetch her, and not to Let her Stay to Long the Sisters told She Choud have patienc, the time would not be long then She woud Say do you think so, then I will be Satisfid Her Class Srs made her a Love-feast, on acount of her Birth-day, on which Ocation, She Express'd her Satisfaction and then kiss'd them heartly, and thank'd them for their Love, She was for Same days in an Extrodenary sweet and Compos'd disposishon, So that one Could desern in her Look, that her time drew near. Which unhappend unexpectedly a bout 4 aClock in the Morning ye 30th instant by reson of an impost in her throught, with the blessing of her Choir By Sr Dorgy drawing duering those words: Pail Lips kiss her on the heart Open Arms take her,
